title: Roger Steffens - 1982-02-07 - "the Reggae Beat" Bob Ma
description:
<a href="http://veryrare.org" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">http://veryrare.org</a>

The Bob Marley Birthday Special
"the Reggae Beat" KCRW-FM
Santa Monica, California
February 7, 1982

Hosted by Roger Steffens

this show included Roger playing rare singles that have most likely been released by now
So sorry but those tracks have been removed so these interviews could be shared

What is left is mostly Bob talking about himself and the world accompanied by a few live recordings
superior quality versions of these live recordings have emerged since this radio show was aired

source:
2 unknown brand cassettes purchased during a Subscription Drive

Transfer:
Nakamichi CR-7A (azimuth aligned to tape, no Dolby, Bias @ 120us) > Korg MN-2000S 1 Bit DFF @ 2.822 MHz >
AudioGate (convert to 24-96) > Audacity (clean up) > AudioGate (convert to 16-44) >
CD wav > Flac (Level 8 > Stamp ID3 Tag editor

disc 1. DC offset correction + 3 dB gain boost and balance, loudest clicks and pops individually removed
disc 2. DC offset correction + 2dB gain boost, loudest clicks and pops individually removed


The reggae beat radio show every Sunday on KCRW-FM in Santa Monica pretty much drove the sales of reggae music in Los Angeles
Working at a small record store back then (Slipped Disc Records) we tried to have all these import (to us) singles and LP's of what we heard on this show.
Most were impossible to obtain here in California.

Supported this public radio station for years and received some rare tapes of Bob playing live in return.
Over time superior quality versions have emerged of these concert tapes.

Here is an interview heavy tribute to Bob on the first birthday after his passing.
Nice to listen to his thoughts.

For historical reference only and not intended for resale or any commercial use.
Enjoy
-M-
Flying M Productions - September 2012
